description:
APPLICATION FOR A LAWFUL DEVELOPMENT CERTIFICATE IN RESPECT OF THE PROPOSED ERECTION OF A REAR DORMER ROOF EXTENSION, INSERTION OF X3 FRONT ROOFLIGHTS AND ERECTION OF A SINGLE 
STOREY REAR EXTENSION.
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The erection of a single storey rear extension would consist of the enlargement of a dwelling house within the meaning of Class A of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Town & Country Planning (General Permitted Development)  (England) Order 2015 "the Order" and would comply with the development tolerances set out in said Class A. The operation would therefore have been granted planning permission by Article 3 of the Order.

Condition : 2 - The erection of a rear roof extension would consist of the enlargement of a dwelling house within the meaning of Class B of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Town & Country Planning (General Permitted Development)  (England) Order 2015 "the Order" and would comply with the development tolerances set out in said Class B. The operation would therefore have been granted planning permission by Article 3 of the Order.

Condition : 3 - The insertion of x3 rooflights to front roofslope would consist of any other alteration to the roof of the dwelling house within the meaning of Class C of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Town & Country Planning (General Permitted Development)  (England) Order 2015 "the Order" and would comply with the development tolerances set out in said Class C. The operation would therefore have been granted planning permission by Article 3 of the Order.

Condition : 4 - INFORMATIVE
Building Regulations 
Please note that this is a certificate of lawfulness only and you may also require approval under the Building Regulations. If you are in any doubt about this you can get further information via https://www.merton.gov.uk/planning-and-buildings/building-control  or by emailing building.control@merton.gov.uk.

Condition : 5 - INFORMATIVE
The applicant should be aware that the site may provide a useful habitat for swifts. Swifts are currently in decline in the UK and in order to encourage and improve the conservation of swifts the applicant is advised to consider the installation of swift nesting box/bricks on site.

Condition : 6 - INFORMATIVE - Bricks
The Council as local planning authority, recognizes the importance of achieving high standards of site practice and workmanship in the course of construction and acknowledges that this will have significant influence upon the quality of the finished brickwork.

The applicant is therefore encouraged to follow the advice set out in the Brick Development Association publication: Good site practice and workmanship (December 2015)  https://www.brick.org.uk/admin/resources/g-good-site-practice-workmanship.pdf when implementing the development hereby approved.
